dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 339 IH: SALT Marriage Penalty Elimination Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Lawler (for himself, Mr. D'Esposito, and Ms. Sherrill) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate the marriage penalty in the limitation on the amount individuals can deduct for certain State and local taxes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the SALT Marriage Penalty Elimination Act.

section.header: Elimination of marriage penalty in limitation on deduction for certain State and local taxes of individuals

subsection.text: Section 164(b)(6)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $10,000 ($5,000 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return) and inserting $10,000 (twice such amount in the case of a joint return).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
